thread.title: Faithless battle John Grant for Number One album
thread.title_full: Faithless battle John Grant for Number One album

title: Faithless battle John Grant for Number One album
text:
Faithless battle John Grant for Number One album Faithless battle John Grant for Number One album Share 
Electronica trio Faithless are on track to land their third number one album in the UK charts. 
Faithless 2.0, the new full-length release from Maxi Jazz, Sister Bliss and Rollo, features a collection of their greatest hits remixed by Avicii, Armin Van Buuren and Eric Prydz. . @faithless and @johnwgrant battle for this week’s Official Albums Chart top spot: http://t.co/zET1NOuWaY pic.twitter.com/SKvH0GEmFt 
— Official Charts (@officialcharts) October 12, 2015 
Only 1,200 copies separate Faithless’ album from John Grant’s new album, Grey Tickles, Black Pressure, according to figures by the Official Charts Company. 
If the album tops the chart on Friday, it would mark the group’s third UK number one, following 2004′s No Roots and 2005′s Forever Faithless – The Greatest Hits. What a journey it has been to this point. Our new album Faithless 2.0 is out now! http://t.co/MkmJkoMiZx pic.twitter.com/IUNuLcNfNh 
— Faithless (@faithless) October 9, 2015 
Rounding off the top five are The Game’s The Documentary 2, Jess Glynne’s former chart-topper I Cry When I Laugh and Ed Sheeran’s x. 
Naughty Boy is hoping to land the coveted top spot with his new single, Runnin’ (Lose It All), which also features Beyonce. The London producer, real name Shahid Khan, faces competition from current chart-topper Justin Bieber and R City. 
Sam Smith’s James Bond theme tune Writing’s On The Wall climbs up one spot to fourth place, with newcomer Jamie Lawson set to take fifth place with his debut single, Wasn’t Expecting That. Share article 
The Plymouth singer-songwriter’s song was originally released in 2011, but has re-released since the 39-year-old signed to Ed Sheeran’s Gingerbread Man Records label. Promoted Stories
